item.title: Trying out Today I Learned posts
item.description: Hey There! Greeting of the season! I am planning to start a TIL Section in my blog where I write some tit-bits I learn here and there over the time of the day, mostly Googling and Stack-Overlfow-ing :sweat-smile: So Check this section out for more! Cheers üç∫

item.title: XClip in Fish Shell
item.description: Wondered if you could just copy the output of a bash command to clipboard and paste it somewhere. XClip is here for your rescue. The Fish Shell 3.0 now supports xclip. How to use : * For copying * $pwd | xclip * Paste it * $cd (xclip -o) PS: In fish to execute a string as a command use paranthesis “( )” instead of backticks “ ` ` “. Just add alias in the fish config :
